intro: Wahlenbergia marginata var. polymorpha, commonly known as the variable wallaby's ear, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, violet-blue flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a creeping habit with fleshy, hairy leaves. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to coastal conditions. Its variability in flower color and leaf shape makes it a distinctive and interesting species for botanical study.
